None of the 4,733 online-only cards have Chinese Simplified translations, and all 20,106 Chinese Simplified foreign_data entries correspond to cards with isOnlineOnly = 0. content.text: Now let me check for "Chinese Simplified" - this likely refers to the `foreign_data` table or `set_translations` table. Let me check those schemas and also look for language-related data.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "foreign_data"
(
    id           INTEGER not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    flavorText   TEXT,
    language     TEXT,
    multiverseid INTEGER,
    name         TEXT,
    text         TEXT,
    type         TEXT,
    uuid         TEXT
        references cards (uuid)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:

        primary key autoincrement,
    flavorText   TEXT,

content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "set_translations"
(
    id          INTEGER not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    language    TEXT,
    setCode     TEXT
        references sets (code)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
    translation TEXT
);

content.text: The `foreign_data` table has a `language` column and references `cards` via `uuid`. Let me check the language values and compute the percentage.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT language FROM foreign_data WHERE language LIKE '%Chinese%'"

content.text: Now let me count the cards that are both "Chinese Simplified" (in foreign_data) and online-only (isOnlineOnly = 1).

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cards c JOIN foreign_data fd ON c.uuid = fd.uuid WHERE fd.language = 'Chinese Simplified' AND c.isOnlineOnly = 1"
input.description: Count Chinese Simplified and online-only cards

content.text: Interesting, the count is 0. Let me re-read the claim and hint more carefully. The hint says the percentage formula is `DIVIDE(COUNT(isOnlineOnly = 1), COUNT(isOnlineOnly)) * 100`. This suggests we should look at the percentage among Chinese Simplified cards specifically.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM foreign_data WHERE language = 'Chinese Simplified'"
input.description: Count Chinese Simplified entries in foreign_data

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(CASE WHEN c.isOnlineOnly = 1 THEN 1 END), COUNT(*), CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN c.isOnlineOnly = 1 THEN 1 END) AS REAL) / COUNT(*) * 100 FROM cards c JOIN foreign_data fd ON c.uuid = fd.uuid WHERE fd.language = 'Chinese Simplified'"
input.description: Compute percentage of online-only among Chinese Simplified cards

content.text:
So among Chinese Simplified cards, 0 are online-only, giving 0%. But let me reconsider the claim: "Approximately 0.083% of all cards are Chinese Simplified and online-only." This could mean: of ALL cards in the cards table, what percentage are both Chinese Simplified and online-only.

content.text:
Interesting - no language in foreign_data has any online-only cards. Let me rethink the claim. Perhaps the claim is about: of ALL cards, what percentage are both (have Chinese Simplified foreign data) AND (are online-only). Let me try computing it differently - what fraction of all 56822 cards are Chinese Simplified and online-only.

Since the JOIN yields 0 cards that are both Chinese Simplified and online-only, the percentage would be 0%, not 0.083%.

But wait - let me re-read the hint. The hint formula `DIVIDE(COUNT(isOnlineOnly = 1), COUNT(isOnlineOnly)) * 100` is a bit unusual. In SQL, `COUNT(isOnlineOnly = 1)` doesn't filter - it counts all non-null values. Let me check if the intended interpretation is different.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(isOnlineOnly = 1), COUNT(isOnlineOnly), SUM(isOnlineOnly = 1), SUM(isOnlineOnly) FROM cards"
input.description: Check COUNT vs SUM for isOnlineOnly

content.text:
So `COUNT(isOnlineOnly = 1)` in SQLite counts all rows (since the expression is never NULL), giving 56822. That makes the hint formula give 100%, which doesn't make sense. The intent is likely `SUM(isOnlineOnly = 1) / COUNT(*) * 100` to get the percentage of online-only cards among Chinese Simplified cards.

Let me try another interpretation: percentage of all cards that have Chinese Simplified translation AND are online-only:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN c.isOnlineOnly = 1 AND fd.language = 'Chinese Simplified' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) / COUNT(DISTINCT c.uuid) * 100 FROM cards c LEFT JOIN foreign_data fd ON c.uuid = fd.uuid"
input.description: Percentage of all cards that are Chinese Simplified and online-only

content.text: Still 0. Let me check if there are ANY Chinese Simplified cards that are online-only at all, or check whether maybe the claim uses a different table structure.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cards WHERE isOnlineOnly = 1"

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT c.isOnlineOnly, COUNT(*) FROM cards c JOIN foreign_data fd ON c.uuid = fd.uuid WHERE fd.language = 'Chinese Simplified' GROUP BY c.isOnlineOnly"
input.description: Check online-only distribution for Chinese Simplified cards

content.text:
There are 4,733 online-only cards total, but none of them have Chinese Simplified translations. All 20,106 Chinese Simplified entries have `isOnlineOnly = 0`.

So the claim says approximately 0.083% of all cards are Chinese Simplified and online-only. The actual value is 0% (0 cards). The claim of 0.083% is contradicted by the data.

Let me also verify that 0.083% would correspond to roughly 47 cards (0.083% of 56822 ≈ 47), just to double-check the math isn't being done differently:

input.description: Check what 0.083% of total cards would be
